body: This fixes a buffer overflow when a malformed *.tox save file is loaded. Again found with AFL and #1331 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1334)

comment_data.body:
There is an allocation that happens above:

```
g->frozen = (Group_Peer *)malloc(sizeof(Group_Peer) * g->numfrozen);
```

do we need to free it before returning or is it fine to just return?
AFAICT this causes a memory leak, but the whole function has this problem, so I'm going to address it in a separate PR.

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1334?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [7418174...3d21e66](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1334?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
@zugz added the fix you mentioned in IRC

* Tuesday, 2019-08-06 at 12:59 -0700 - nurupo <notifications@github.com>:

>do we need to free it before returning or is it fine to just return?

It's fine to just return. There's no leak here, afaics.

See the API documentation on tox_new: "If loading failed or succeeded 
only partially, the new or partially loaded instance is returned and an 
error code is set". If there's an error, tox_kill should still be called 
to free whatever was allocated.

For groups: tox_kill calls kill_groupchats, which frees everything, 
including g->frozen for each g.

Ok, then it seems to be correct.

I have to add thought IMO this is bad API design and we should not require the user of the API to call `tox_kill` themselves.

>I have to add thought IMO this is bad API design and we should not 
>require the user of the API to call `tox_kill` themselves.

I think the point is that the returned tox object might be usable even 
if there was an error somewhere in loading, so clients may prefer not to 
blindly kill the tox object in this case.

I have initially went all the way up the call tree to see if it gets freed anywhere in there and couldn't find it. Didn't realize it gets freed through `tox_kill()`. I'd free things as soon as they become unneeded, but I guess the way it's currently done makes sense given toxcore API design.

commit.message:
fix missing group title length check

This fixes a buffer overflow when a malformed *.tox save file is
loaded.
